description.text: Page no. 17 from an old magazine, "Risala Kok Shastar, Lahore" with sketches of four models showcasing fashion trends (upmarket apparels, hairstyles, jewellery etc) of the time, early 1900s. The page is printed in red ink and it is divided into four equal rectangular boxes and each box contains a sketch. In clock-wise order- "Miss Gauhar Jahan", who wears a saree and poses crossed hands. Next to her is the "Gentleman Lady" (who wears a western outfit and carries an umbrella and flower basket); Bottom right is "Shauqeen Aurat" (the woman who lives her life to the fullest) poses crosslegged on a chair. She wears Mughal style dress. Also seen a flower vase kept on the side table). Bottom left is the Dana aurat (the wise lady), who poses with her arm resting against the sofa.

inscription.text: مس گوہر جان . جنٹلمین لیڈی . شوقین عورت. دانا عورت ملکھی رام مصور، لاہور
Gentleman lady, Miss Goharjan, Shauqeen aurat, Dana aurat Malkhi Ram Musavvir, Lahore

text-transcription-ur: Gentleman lady, Miss Goharjan, Shauqeen aurat, Dana aurat Malkhi Ram Musavvir, Lahore

description-en: Page no. 17 from an old magazine, "Risala Kok Shastar, Lahore" with sketches of four models showcasing fashion trends (upmarket apparels, hairstyles, jewellery etc) of the time, early 1900s. The page is printed in red ink and it is divided into four equal rectangular boxes and each box contains a sketch. In clock-wise order- "Miss Gauhar Jahan", who wears a saree and poses crossed hands. Next to her is the "Gentleman Lady" (who wears a western outfit and carries an umbrella and flower basket); Bottom right is "Shauqeen Aurat" (the woman who lives her life to the fullest) poses crosslegged on a chair. She wears Mughal style dress. Also seen a flower vase kept on the side table). Bottom left is the Dana aurat (the wise lady), who poses with her arm resting against the sofa.

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Gauhar Jaan (Jahan) 1873–1930, was an Indian singer and dancer from Calcutta. She was of Armeniandescent but later converted to Islam. She was one of the first performers to record music on 78 rpm records in India. The prefix "Miss" was added to the name of the educated ladies belonging/moving with the upper class. The term "Gentleman lady" was a derviative from the word, Gentelman and it was used for "English/British" ladies, who were cultured and belonged to the upper strata of the society. Shauqeen Aurat- was the term used for a woman who enjoyed her life by participating in social activities, going to cinema house, wearing makeup, jewellery and trendy clothes. (ys)

Gauhar Jaan (Jahan) 1873–1930, was an Indian singer and dancer from Calcutta. She was of Armeniandescent but later converted to Islam. She was one of the first performers to record music on 78 rpm records in India. The prefix "Miss" was added to the name of the educated ladies belonging/moving with the upper class. The term "Gentleman lady" was a derviative from the word, Gentelman and it was used for "English/British" ladies, who were cultured and belonged to the upper strata of the society. Shauqeen Aurat- was the term used for a woman who enjoyed her life by participating in social activities, going to cinema house, wearing makeup, jewellery and trendy clothes.
